title: I'm a 15-year-old Christian and 7 months pregnant with my Muslim boyfriend. What should I do? - Quora

response.answer_text: I'm a 15-year-old Christian and 7 months pregnant with my Muslim boyfriend. What should I do? If you haven’t told your parents, tell them now. They need to get you adequate medical care because you’ll be giving birth soon and that’s going to be a rough experience. You haven’t got much time to decide whether you’ll keep the baby or give it up for adoption and even less time to prepare. Do NOT expect your boyfriend to stay. Do NOT expect to get any financial support or other help from him. It’s got nothing to do with religion. Teen boys typically lose interest once a baby arrives because a girl is no fun anymore—she’ll be lucky to get two consecutive hours of sleep because the baby’s demands are constant. She has no time or attention for a boyfriend anymore. Rely on your parents now. They’ll be there for you.

I’m 17 years old and I got pregnant at 16. This is what I’m going to tell you so listen closely. You are not a “slut” you are not a “ho” or a “whore” because people are going to forever say these words to you. Talk with your parents. Sit down with them and have a vulnerable conversation. Speak about your baby. If you wanna keep it tell them. If you want to give it up for adoption ask them for their support. But if you keep that baby you love it with all your heart. It’s going to be extremely hard in the beginning. You won’t be sleeping, you feed your baby every 2 hours, and you probably won’t take a shower most days. You do what you think is the best for you. If you think that you don’t have a good support system and your baby won’t thrive with you then I would advise you to give that child up for adoption. It’s gonna be scary. But you are strong girly!! I’m cheering for you over here. If you have any questions or just wanna rant leave a comment and we can figure something out. It’s okay to cry too. It’s a hard time for you.
